divs: Sighting DetailsI was standing on my front porch. The sky was absolutely clear, except for a tiny cloud over the valley. Because of that I looked up and watched the cloud grow as if it were in a speeded up time frame (very fast). I watched it grow speedily for a few seconds then looked to the side (about at 2 o'clock) and saw a tiny round object sitting in the sky. It was white, light gray, or silver. I moved my eyes back to the little cloud that was still expanding quickly. A second cloud had sprung to being and was also growing quickly. I reached inside my screen door and got my binoculars that I keep there (I'm an avid bird watcher), and looked at the sphere thru them. It had no unusual features even seen thru the binoculars, just like a little round ball. I looked back at the clouds, then back at the sphere only to realize it was no longer there. I hadn't seen it leave, and don't know where it went. The clouds began to fade and were soon gone, leaving the sky absolutely clear again. I saw nothing further. I'm sorry I didn't have time for photos, but I did a quick recreation in Photoshop. Linda Matusich
